item.description:
What: "Fruitnic" @ McCruelty Protest
When: Saturday, May 4th, 1:00 p.m.–3:00 p.m.
Where: OUTSIDE McDonald's, 146 Tremont street, Boston
(See this map. http://goo.gl/maps/ibSH)
Contact: Laura Ray at laurasunray@hotmail.com or 617-512-3468
BYOF: Bring your own fruit for "Fruitnic" on sidewalk or Common.

Please join other compassionate activists in handing out McCruelty leaflets and holding signs in order to inform passersby of the cruelty [http://mccruelty.com/why.aspx] behind every McNugget. Chickens raised for McDonald's [http://www.McCruelty.com/] are slaughtered using an archaic method that results in extreme suffering. As one of the biggest sellers of chicken in the U.S., McDonald's has the responsibility—and the ability—to reduce this abuse by demanding that its U.S. and Canadian suppliers use a less cruel slaughter method.

Here are the protest details:
All posters and leaflets will be provided. Please dress conservatively to avoid distracting from our message and note that reserved parking will not be available. If this is your first time attending an outreach event please review PETA's tips for attending a demonstration. [http://www.mediapeta.com/peta/PDF/tips_for_activists.pdf]
item.how_to_find_us: Look for people holding signs on the sidewalk.
item.name: "Fruitnic" @ McCruelty Protest
